utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hi. Uh, I've just had this cough for the past week and I was worried I might have Covid so I just wanted to um I just wanted to be checked.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Sure, so you mentioned you, it started a week ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Has it been persistent or does it come and go?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I just get this itchy sort of uh like scratchy sensation in my throat. And then I just cough and um that makes it better.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK, uhm what, how would you describe your cough like is it barky? Is it harsh? Is it muffled?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm no, I don't I don't think it's barky or harsh.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and does anything make it better or worse like you know, like the cold air, laying down, at particular time of day?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not really, I haven't uh, nothing's really helped. Um I also tried a cough syrup, um it didn't, it helped for a couple hours, but then it was back again. The cough was back again.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you ever experienced anything like this in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh well, I I said yeah when I get a cold.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Once a year? OK. Um do you experience any shortness of breath with this cough?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. Is it a dry cough or do you bring up any phlegm?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uh any blood that you've seen?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. And do you feel wheezy?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, um feeling like your heart's racing?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. Do you ever feel like your nose is stuffy or runny?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, any changes in your vision or hearing?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um loss of smell or taste?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I checked no, no, I don't have a fever.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Issues uh, any changes in your bowel movements?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um uh no, I've just been constipated from time to time, but that's nothing, that's not new.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, constipation. And I'm sorry when did your constipation start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh it's a problem for years. I don't eat enough fibre.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh, OK. Any changes in your urine?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. Are you otherwise healthy? Do you have any longstanding medical conditions?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how long have you had diabetes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's about, it's been uh seven years now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any hospitalizations or surgeries in the past?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and um how about medications? Are you on any?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh yeah, I've been taking uh metformin for the past uh, for the past five years, when, five or six years.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um and uh my family Doc started me on uh ramipril about two weeks ago, he told me that uh now that I'm 50, I need to I need to be on this pill as well, so now I have to take 2 pills instead of one.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah because I think it's it's good for my heart or something.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, for sure. So you started that two weeks ago, OK. Are you up to date with all your immunizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm penicillin, I just get uh I get a rash. I got a rash when I was a child, I haven't had it since then.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. Any family history of lung or heart conditions?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, how about, uh, marijuana or other recreational drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh yeah, I drink on the weekends.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, what do you drink and how much do you drink?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I'll have maybe two or three uh bottles of beer.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK sure, and um have you been in contact with any sick people recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no, I've just been staying at home.I'm just scared of covid, but I'm I'm still worried I might have somehow gotten it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, for sure. Uhm, any travel recently?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. And where do you live right now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I live in a house with my wife and my two kids.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any old carpet, dust, mold, or asbestos in your home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um not that I'm aware of.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. OK, well it seems like um those are all the questions that I had for you today. Did you have any questions of your own?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, I just want to get tested for Covid.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, so we will definitely do a Covid swab on you because you have a cough, um and those results should come back to you in about 24 to 48 hours, and so you'll know more then. But because your symptoms do overlap with that of Covid, we still recommend isolating for 14 days. But the other thing I want to mention is that you don't have any other symptoms of infection besides your cough, and it seems like the cough started a week ago and you started this new medication ramipril two weeks ago, and so ramipril is a type of ACE inhibitor and one of its side effects is that in some people it can cause coughing. So, I am going to review your medications and if your family Doc also agrees, we may try uh another um blood pressure medication for you instead of ramipril.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um so we'll try and change that medication and see if your coughing stops. How does that sound?
